website_summaries.verdict: This is one of the cheaper fish finders on the market, so for those wanting to try out the technology, it’s a workable option.
pros: Simple display that’s easy to read and use
Works in temperatures well below freezing
cons: Only offers 25 feet of cable (but has a 328-foot depth range)
Not enough features for advanced anglers

customer_reviews.title: Accurate.
customer_reviews.text: Accurate depth readings. Fish finding capabilities seemed accurate. However, after using it a couple of times it started locking up and it became necessary to continually reboot it. Sent it back. ***Update: Venterior refunded my purchase price AND sent me a free replacement unit. Who does that? Well, VENTERIOR does. Even if you pay a little more it’s worth it to do business with a company that practices old fashioned integrity. Buy with ABSOLUTE CONFIDENCE!
customer_reviews.author: D.G.

customer_reviews.title: Prefect for what I need
customer_reviews.text: I use it on my kayak just to check depths, seems pretty accurate. Lost one star because it resets the settings when ever it shuts off, but meters to feet conversion isn't that hard. Update, I was sent a new one which does now keep settings when turned off. So works perfectly for what I need it for!
customer_reviews.author: JAMES BRIDGES

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Once you figure it out and set it to your fishing environment..this thing is awesome! I used it in my canoe and Intex inflatable--and in both vessels I used sticky Velcro to adhere the finder and its cord to the side of the boat so that I could control depth, etc. I always take a spare set of batteries out with me; however, I found my Finder worked well into the 5th hour of continued use.
customer_reviews.author: SWeigh

customer_reviews.title: Did not work out of box also a faceplate was not attached
customer_reviews.text: I'm writing this from you to express my dissatisfaction in this product I bought the fish finder in the 3-year protection plan and when I unbox the fish finders the faceplate was not even attached and also I tried two sets of brand new batteries and I cannot even get it to stay on the battery seems very loose in the back would like a response from the seller
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Prefect present
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a Valentine’s Day gift for my boyfriend who’s an avid ice fisher. This is great, works great and he loves it! He’ll drill 300 holes(not really more like 12) and ‘find’ them all and place his tip ups accordingly. Definitely helps to cut out the days we get shut out on a lake, as long as we check the holes we know we’re goin to pull something through the ice!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Ann

customer_reviews.title: Works as well as the big boys.
customer_reviews.text: For less than $40, this is a great finder. I have used it shore, ice, kayak, and boat fishing. There are no fancy features, but finds the depth and fish as well as my brother's Garmin striker. It is also easier to tote than the striker. I use rechargable AAA batteries that last several days trips before needing recharge. With the batteries and charger, I still spent less than $60 for a great finder. The two features I would like are, 1 the ability to see your lure depth. 2, I wish I could change the lanyard position so I can hang it right side up in my ice tent.
customer_reviews.author: Shin Sano

customer_reviews.title: If you are looking for a simple way to locate some fish and know what depth you are fishing then I would definitely recommend this fish finder
customer_reviews.text: This unit keeps it very simple but works quite well for the budget minded fisherman. Have used many time in a small lake by my house and it has changed the way I fish and definitely gives me an advantage over the fish without breaking the bank. If you are looking for a simple way to locate some fish and know what depth you are fishing then I would definitely recommend this fish finder.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Maupin

customer_reviews.title: Probably a great product, BUT I could not stand being tethered ...
customer_reviews.text: Probably a great product, BUT I could not stand being tethered to it. It was for use when fishing out of kayaks and was frustrating. For the money, it may be fine if you are fishing from a bank or don't mind the mile long cord. Also, need to let the cord sit out to remove the memory in it. It was not quick to relax and the float actually kept coming back to the kayak.
customer_reviews.author: Angie F

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. Bought this unit to find the depth of water for crabbing. Never came close to an accurate reading. Would have returned this but misplaced the box, when I found it, it was too late to return.
customer_reviews.author: jenn1473

customer_reviews.title: Best inexpensive fish finder
customer_reviews.text: This fish finder is the one to buy for ice fishing if u don't want to buy an expensive one. It obviously isn't as good as a $300 one, but I took it out first day icefishing. You can see the video on strikeforce fishing on YouTube. Caught 15 fish in 4 hours. Many of them crappiest caught jigging with this fish finder. Word of caution :DO NOT GET THE DISPLAY UNIT WET. It isnt waterproof or even water resistant. Just keep it in a Tupperware or other waterproof container. The price is well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic economic fish finder
customer_reviews.text: An ok fish finder, gives you the general location, the depth feature is great and using it on ice is just as easy as attaching it to your boat. The best part of this is the company that sells it. I bought mine 6 months ago, received an email from venterior checking on how it was working. Well the bottom feature didn't work, it wouldn't pick up plant life or rocks. I told them this and I'm getting a new on shipped free. Definitely a good buy
customer_reviews.author: rich

customer_reviews.title: These people have the very BEST CUSTOMER SERVICE I HAVE EVER HAD from any company
customer_reviews.text: These people have the very BEST CUSTOMER SERVICE I HAVE EVER HAD from any company. After purchasing this product I had some questions after reading the manual. They replied VERY FAST. with great information. That information raised another question EVERY QUESTION I HAD the reply was very fast and answered the question completely . The product is a fish finder it works wonderful --the side view is Excellent. I use it to view in front of the boat vs going over the fish to view them. My wife LOVES IT..She can see the fish before we get to them. Venterior Fish Finder Model VT-001 portable
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Package but failed to perform
customer_reviews.text: In theory this was perfect for a kayak fisher not wanting to spend 200$ on a fishfinder and battery plus wiring and time however it fell short on accuracy - I tried at multiple levels and it failed to detect any fish even when was later able to catch one. Also depth accuracy isnt great - its close enough for a kayak but I would be hard pressed to recommend on anything larger.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Irizarry

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great when I fish off my kayak and also worked great for ice fishing.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: OK, so I bought this to try ice fishing. It works great for verifying depth and shows fish a different depths. I have also tried it Kayak fishing. Again it work. For the price of $40-cant go wrong. I've had it about 6 months and no issues. Just wish the unit was waterproof. If it was waterproof I'd give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Town Q.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: I bought the product two months ago and used it for the first time yesterday. It wouldn't register any depth. I'm outside of the return window so now I'm out my forty dollars too. On the plus side, the item is very portable and seems easy to use though it it didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Rocket Man

customer_reviews.title: working just fine now.
customer_reviews.text: I have only used it once, and dropped it in the water too... but grabbed it, tried to get as much water out of the unit and then took it home and gently used my wife's hair dryer on it... working just fine now... takes a little getting used to, but I would buy it again...
customer_reviews.author: Spokane Dude

customer_reviews.title: Power Fish Finder- Perfect for Kayaking
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fish finder for kayaking. Includes a 25ft cord with sonar to locate fish, but you don't have to use all 25 ft. I use about 6 inches to throw from the side of my kayak and coil the rest. Has a sensitivity setting to detect smaller and larger fish. Also had an audible alarm for detecting fish which can be turned off. One side note is water sensitivity. The screen does not function well with the slighest amount if water. However, if you are looking for a powerful fish finder with many features for around $40 and perfect for kayaking, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: tcb113

customer_reviews.title: Dead after one season.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it last year for crab season. Worked OK but not flawlessly for depth finding only: maybe 8 or 10 trips on the dinghy. This year, after careful storage in cool dry boathouse with batteries removed, it was dead. Never dropped nor gotten wet. Look upon it as a one-season purchase. You decide if low price makes that ok for you.
customer_reviews.author: WA islander

customer_reviews.title: Ehh
customer_reviews.text: I can never get this thing to work. Sometimes it does sometimes it doesn’t. Could just be a user error but either way I wouldn’t recommend the purchase. There’s a lot of cord length which might be beneficial to some but I kept feeling as though everything was getting tangled
customer_reviews.author: Tristen Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it, used it. Didn’t like it, returned it. Waste of money in my opinion. If using from a dock it doesn’t stay in the water where you want it. It floats away from where your trying to fish. Save your money and buy a nice one.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Best fish finder at this price range
customer_reviews.text: For the price and what it’s capabilities are, it’s very good. I’ve used it quite a bit and I am happy with its performance. You can’t expect it to compete with models that are over $100, so don’t think that is going to be as good as those.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not dependable
customer_reviews.text: This was cool in the sense that it is small and portable but it stopped working after 10 minutes. Full batteries and all, but it stopped showing depth regardless the settings I used. Very clear water with a sandy bottom around 15 ft of water but won't read. Checked connections, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Grizzleypaws

customer_reviews.title: What I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: I got to use it a few times ice fishing and it worked well. Couldn't get it to work through the ice, although I didn't really try that hard. Seems to be pretty accurate as far as depth goes. I haven't had enough use with it yet to determine if the fish finding portion of it is accurate. Doesn't seem to be sensitive enough to pick up 2" sized lures. Next time I have it out I plan on testing larger lures to see how big of a fish it can pick up. Overall I'm pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: David Pedersen

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: Haven't been able to use it much this winter. But, we did have one warm day this year where my boyfriend took this fish finder out to try it. "Casting" it into the water was a bit tricky and will take some practice. However, once in the water it was able to pick up even the tiniest fish.
customer_reviews.author: lndsy

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Did not work. Would not even work when my small float tube was still and not moving. Did not even have an accurate depth. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Anton

customer_reviews.title: I had problems with a defective unit
customer_reviews.text: Defective unit was replaced by Venterior at their suggestion and shipped free. Very good company to work with. The new unit works great.
customer_reviews.author: Lake Keystone

customer_reviews.title: Very portable
customer_reviews.text: Used it all winter ice fishing and it worked perfectly. It's nice that it's very portable which makes it very handy. Good accuracy and fairly easy to use which is a plus. Looking forward to using it with my canoe as soon as the weather gets nice, should work very well.
customer_reviews.author: Prop

customer_reviews.title: Solid product, great seller
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job - and the seller is terrific. You won’t find a better option for the money. Reads depths nicely, identifies fish at the right depths... If you’re in the fish, leave on the chime. It’ll get your blood pumping.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Glinatsis

customer_reviews.title: Decent product in a pinch
customer_reviews.text: I took this with me to Ontario for walleye fishing, and had it dangling over the side of the boat all week. The depth readings seemed fairly accurate, though I had no way to confirm. Most surprising to me was that one set of batteries lasted through 6 days of fishing, because I thought I read somewhere that they would only last a few hours. As with any "fish finder", I never relied on any of the fish indications, or lack thereof.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Stock

customer_reviews.title: mixed bag
customer_reviews.text: Tried two of these. The first one worked relatively well. The cord was very cumbersome and the read seemed to be hit or miss because of the large icon used to display fish. So we mostly used this as a depth finder. The second one we purchased (because the first one was left out to the elements and rain and got ruined) was a complete lemon. It would intermittently read any depth, most the time when we turned it on, the screen would just remain blank or flash.
customer_reviews.author: Salenta

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Just got this. For the price, it is excellent. Easy to use and accurate. Using for depth sounding for my 25 ' sailboat. Mostly to determine dock depths at local restaurants etc. One thing in other reviews I haven't found true is mine does seem to keep the depth setting in feet after being turned off and back on. So far, very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Max F.

customer_reviews.title: Great 5 start product from 5 start company
customer_reviews.text: I am really impressed with this fish finder. It is easy to use, reliable, and accurate. In addition the company really back up their product and will help with any issues you may have.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Chay

customer_reviews.title: GREAT AND PRACTICAL UNIT
customer_reviews.text: I use it now for some time and are still very satisfied with it. It is also practical in shallow, uncharted water. Connect the unit on the boats hook and extend it forward in the bow to see any obstructions and depth in front.
customer_reviews.author: everhardo

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: We got this to use while kayaking. It's very accurate and lightweight and doesn't take up much room. Perfect for fishing in our kayaks. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Kendra

customer_reviews.title: Works as described and is pretty sensitive-really picks up the fish
customer_reviews.text: Works as described and is pretty sensitive-really picks up the fish. The audible alarm is a nice feature. Tells you whether bottom is weedy or firm structure. I had some questions about the product and the company stood behind their product. Might be nice if it was rechargeable, but that certainly is no must, it's easy to change batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Gorniak

customer_reviews.title: When will I get my money back to my card
customer_reviews.text: This product it doesn’t give accurate this is why I have Return the item is still hasn’t seen credit back to my card yet
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A worthy tool to improve odds when fishing.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a Christmas gift I recently asked how it was going. Battery life is better than expected. Performance is up to par with high end fish finders and quality speaks for itself as it’s still in use. He doesn’t go fishing without it.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: -words
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this I thought it would work good. I was wrong . Used it twice fishing and the cord literally just fell apart. So cheap wasn’t worth trying to get a refund. Not sorry for honesty. I’ll do a video unboxing but I won’t pay for another one
customer_reviews.author: william Price

customer_reviews.title: Solid product
customer_reviews.text: Works well for a cheap fish finder. There is a lot of wiring that can be a pain to keep wrapping up to put away. Also difficult to change measurements from meters to feet. Otherwise works very well
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Second chance never hurt anyone (:
customer_reviews.text: I honesty think mine is broken it doesn’t work properly it says there is fish when it’s out of the water I’m going to test it again today on my fishing trip I hope it works as expected
customer_reviews.author: Loyal  customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised, good price.
customer_reviews.text: Working well for my dad. The cord is very long, I wish they would provide an alternate cable method that is shorter for kayaking and ice fishing. Dad uses it to quickly check depth when ice fishing versus setting up his main unit just to check depth.
customer_reviews.author: Dallas

customer_reviews.title: 1st finder I got only worked a short time. Amazon replaced in short order
customer_reviews.text: Product is light and very portable. I use primarily as a depth finder, but the fish finder is helpful as well. Customer service from Amazon was very good at replacing 1st defective finder. Currently satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: wayne spencer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome customer service!!
customer_reviews.text: It's very reasonably priced and works well. I use it mostly for depth of water. But the customer service was the best I've dealt with ever. So nice and willing to go up and beyond to help out!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Sargent

customer_reviews.title: Portable, simple, useful
customer_reviews.text: Small, light and easy to carry along with my float tube for fishing hike-in lakes. Good battery life and accurate depth readings. Not sure if the fish-finder aspect tells the truth, but that's typical with economical fish-finder/depth-finder gadgets. I carry it along as back-up for my more expensive Hummingbird depth-finder when using my pontoon boat.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a gift for someone and they loved it
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Useless device
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use on a fishing trip. The data it gives was out to lunch Compared to other reliable units. Example, in 32’ of water with several fish present, as confirmed by 2 other units we showed 120’ and lots of fish. Unless device. If I could return it I would.
customer_reviews.author: Edward the 3rd

customer_reviews.title: For the price this is nice!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to check depth while drilling ice holes and check for fish. It works great to about 60 feet of water. I also found that using Lithium batteries work the best. For the price this unit is what you would expect.
customer_reviews.author: james tucker

customer_reviews.title: This thing is unfair to the fish
customer_reviews.text: bought it for a friend, he's a local celebrity now because of the size of the fish he's been catching on a regular basis. Simple, rugged... just works. Barbecues will never be the same.
customer_reviews.author: Arbab Khan

customer_reviews.title: Much better then expected for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use. Gives you a very basic idea on where fish are and how deep the water is. Handy for kayak or float fishing. Also handy ice fishing. Caught over 100 perch using this fish finder. It's better then I expected for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Faded fishing guru

customer_reviews.title: Not for bank fishing
customer_reviews.text: Good luck trying to use from the bank. Shouldn’t advertise that.
customer_reviews.author: cliff denny

customer_reviews.title: Great consumer service
customer_reviews.text: I had a problem with this fish finder. They gave me a list of ways to troubleshoot. I was still unable to get it to work and they help replace this item within 2 days. Saved my fishing trip this weekend! Would definitely purchase from this company again
customer_reviews.author: Jaime Weinstein

customer_reviews.title: A homerun! Great little fish finder!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this to check the depth when Ice fishing and it’s a sweet little finder! Love the fact that it only takes AAA’s and is small and compact! Love this litttle finder and can’t wait to use it more!
customer_reviews.author: Mikegardner88

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: I'm not completely impressed with the fish finder. But as a depth finder it's worth the buy. Portable and not expensive. Works great in the kayak
customer_reviews.author: Daren

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The one that I did notice, is that turtles will show up as fish on the display.
customer_reviews.author: Peter jay parris

customer_reviews.title: I have no way of knowing for sure but I ...
customer_reviews.text: I have no way of knowing for sure but I believe that the depth reading is accurate. Not sure about the fish part and the accuracy of the type of bottom terrain.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Did not work properly
customer_reviews.text: Did not work properly - erroneous depth readings. Sent back
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: It's a good little fish finder
customer_reviews.text: It's a good little fish finder. Can't tell the difference between a minnow and a great white shark, but if there is a fish under it you will get an alert. Setup is simple.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: simple
customer_reviews.text: A simple depth finder with enough features that make it work very well for ice fishing
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: decent fish finder.
customer_reviews.text: Oy used it once. Mainly for depth, but it was good for finding fish too, used it on a rental boat in the Easter sierra, very eased with the performance.
customer_reviews.author: Mars

customer_reviews.title: i have no idea
customer_reviews.text: it maybe gives you an idea on depth but as far as finding fish you may as well use a magic 8 ball.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Groves

customer_reviews.title: Portability, and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Its a small easy to use and inexpensive fish finder.
customer_reviews.author: Earl M

customer_reviews.title: This item is too heavy and the display looks like an old handheld video game i used to play ...
customer_reviews.text: It is a clunky piece of hardware with limited uses. Maybe a cheap fish finder for a small boat. Do not use when fishing from a shore as the cable sinks to the bottom every time and it is impossible to keep above water without reeling in the sensor. This item is too heavy and the display looks like an old handheld video game i used to play as a kid. Probably not worth buying but i didn't use it in all situations. Also cable broke on first use.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Accurate depth and a good,not great interface. For the money, well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: W. Malo

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money :).
customer_reviews.text: Cute little fish finder! My husband said it works pretty well to be so inexpensive. Glad I got it for for him for his birthday :).
customer_reviews.author: Savannah

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful product. I use it from my kayak when fishing for steelhead in the river. Very accurate and it has help me find the fish! No problems at all after a season of use.
customer_reviews.author: reviewerjoe

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality
customer_reviews.text: Got it as a gift and came nicely packaged, seems high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Use it for ice fishing and jon boat fishing, works good for a depth finder decent for seeing apox depth of fish
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An expensive one would probably work better. Accurate at reading depth
customer_reviews.text: An expensive one would probably work better. Accurate at reading depth, but tends to get confused with the amount of fish and size. It found a turtle colony for my cousin!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Depth finder works, does not mark fish
customer_reviews.text: While it’s definitely portable, it does not work correctly to find fish. It shows the depth when compared to another similar fish finder, but does not mark the fish
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: doesn't work in murky water
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son for ice fishing and gave it a try and nothing. It said that the water needs to be cleaner. All of the lakes around here are very dirty so this will probably not work . Easy to use if you can get it to work.
customer_reviews.author: terry theis

customer_reviews.title: Good for water depth but not finding any 🐟
customer_reviews.text: It works sometimes,it could be more accurate. I took it to the lake and seen fish under my boat but they wasn't coming up on the fish finder
customer_reviews.author: Doug Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: useful for telling depths, but thinks anything in the water is fish.
customer_reviews.author: gunhwang

customer_reviews.title: Great finder!
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves it. Says it works great. Highly recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: VICKY YOUNG-OWEN

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Have used this on my kayaks several times works great.
customer_reviews.author: Joe 532

customer_reviews.title: Very cheap - won't cry if my kids break it.
customer_reviews.text: I think it works - very cheap construction- typos throughout the instructions. Keeps my kids interested when no fish are biting.
customer_reviews.author: J R Plummer

customer_reviews.title: Depth Meter Doesn't Work
customer_reviews.text: Nice Little Unit if it worked. Tried it ice fishing last week and alls it did was turn on with no readings. It would be nice to speak with someone on the phone, but cant find a number for it. Amazon and the shipping was great! Bad product I'm guessing
customer_reviews.author: DMAC

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great little gadget. Was going to the west coast of Florida fishing and for the price it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: DualDrive 36

customer_reviews.title: 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work good ordered for a friend and he said it works good. Update coming soon after I use it.
customer_reviews.author: Shane M.

customer_reviews.title: Value for your dollar
customer_reviews.text: Just don't expect too much from the unit, It does what it says it will do, no more no less
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: ... twice so far but it seems to be a good product. We did catch fish using it
customer_reviews.text: Only used this twice so far but it seems to be a good product. We did catch fish using it!
customer_reviews.author: Hammercl

customer_reviews.title: Ok for depth
customer_reviews.text: So its pretty much only good for suspended fish i was getting fish on and it didnt pick them up till i brought them up. Depth seems accurate. If you're planning on using for ice fishing i would pretty much consider this a depth finder.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: This product is junk and only worked for about an hour. I followed the horrible instruction and nothing worked. I tried on multiple occasions and it still failed to work properly.
customer_reviews.author: joseph_b

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Wish it was waterproof. But it's not. Mine actually went for a swim. However, after immediately removing the batteries and some rice for 24 hours it works fine again. It was submerged for about 10 minutes and completely filled with water.
customer_reviews.author: Symberly

customer_reviews.title: fishing with a friend and no fish finder
customer_reviews.text: If you are camping an make a new friend who wants to go fishing but you have no fishfinder this 1 is small and you can have it with you when you needed it if you fish you need a fishfinder for to find fish and depth of water Myself I find this very handy to have carry a few batteries and off you go.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good deal !
customer_reviews.text: Nice little unit for the money . Seems quite accurate for depths and picks up fish well . To extend battery life make sure you use optional settings .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for cheap
customer_reviews.text: Took it ice fishing and it was reading out very nice from depth to the amount of fish under me very accurately
customer_reviews.author: Steve Jewell

customer_reviews.title: Little bit nice little bit garbage
customer_reviews.text: Worked to find depths occasionally, using it for ice fishing...sometimes you're in 18ft of water and 5 feet away your in 272'...catching perch out of 4 holes and it wont mark fish in any of them
customer_reviews.author: nathan

customer_reviews.title: Not good for ice fishing!!
customer_reviews.text: It’s works good on my small boat!! But ice fishing not so much, when it gets cold it just get kinda weird it will start beeping on off randomly and will randomly shut off! Spend the extra money and get the Garmin striker 4!!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Nye

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as a Garmin or striker but is helpful.
customer_reviews.text: Won't read depth past 30 feet of water. I use it ice fishing and it works ok in anything less than 30 ft. You can tell when fish come up off the bottom and go back down because it will show the fish symbol when he comes up and then it turns to a weed for stump structure when he goes down.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff M.

customer_reviews.title: East to use
customer_reviews.text: Nice easy unit, great for any floatation device also good ice fishing buddy. Only down fall is cord way to long
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works as expected.
customer_reviews.text: This tool Works well for finding depth and is a lil inaccurate for fish finding but at this price it does a pretty great job!
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Worth every cent plus yo momma
customer_reviews.text: Well it did exactly as needed. All of those crying about having to switch to ft everytime they turn it on well its as easy as holding down one button for like 3 seconds OH NO!!!! Anyway I dropped a line right on where this marked a fish and pow had a fish.
customer_reviews.author: The Truth

customer_reviews.title: great prize and review
customer_reviews.text: Arrive on time, great prize and review, can't wait for summer to try.
customer_reviews.author: DJFerdz

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Performed pretty much as described. Has been very helpful when i go ice fishing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great in open water
customer_reviews.text: This product always gets confuse with weeds. You are getting what you paid for. Works great in open water.
customer_reviews.author: AmBrenda

customer_reviews.title: Depth only. No fish
customer_reviews.text: Good enough to tell depth. Used ice fishing. Only registers directly below it usually as I’m reeling in the fish. Had fish on the line from hole 18” away with no blip on the finder
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This thing is useless. All it is good for is reading the ...
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this. This thing is useless. All it is good for is reading the depth of the water. The fish finder doesn't work and beeps if you move at all.
customer_reviews.author: julian

customer_reviews.title: Good basic fishfinder
customer_reviews.text: Good basic fish finder. Easy to operate, easy to read. -1 star for battery life, even in batt saver mode. Would recomend getting 2 sets (8 batteries) of rechargeables.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great for a decent price.
customer_reviews.text: Loved the fish finder. We used it this winter on the ice and we were very happy with it. Only drawback that we found is that it's not waterproof, but it's not a big problem, just have to set it on a bucket on something.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Venterior VT-FF001 Portable Fish Finder, Handheld Fishfinder Fish Depth Finder with Sonar Sensor Transducer and LCD Display
feature_bullets: Shows you what is in the water: Detects and displays water depth, approximate fish location (suits for all sorts of fish), short & tall weeds, sand & rocks on seabed. Suitable for fishing from a kayak, off the dock, and ice fishing. You can use the fish finder on moving kayak with slowly speed below 5mph (make sure the bottom of the transducer is horizontal).

Easy to Use: Toss the transducer into water and turn on the display unit, it will show you the water depth and approximate fish depth if fish schools passing by. It has 5 user selectable sensitivity; battery save mode; backlight mode ; fish alarm; unit of measure. Setting can be saved when turned off.

Very portable that you can take it anywhere: It comes with neck strap that allow you to wear it around neck when you are busy on the kayak. And you can easily store the fish finder in your tackle box. The fishfinder is powered by 4 AAA batteries. It lasts 4-5 hours with new batteries in continuous use. It can be used in fresh water as well as salt/sea water.

Accurate Depth Reading: The fish finder use sonar to detect water depth and fish location. Sonar Frequency is 200 kHZ. Detectable area is 45 degrees beam angle under the sonar transducer. Detectable depth range is from 3ft/1m to 328ft/100m below the sonar transducer.

Warranty and Brand Support: The Venterior Portable Fish Finder is covered by a 2-year Warranty. Any issue of the fish finder after purchase, please don't hesitate to contact our brand support (warranty card comes with product in package), we will response within 24 hours every day online.
